entity.name: Interop issues
entity.description: Browser support issues, implementation bugs, cross‑browser implementation differences or inconsistencies, browser prioritization, speed of adoption of new features, any issues where specific browsers, browser engines, or browser companies are mentioned (and it’s not to praise them).

entity.name: `<template>`
entity.description: A mechanism for holding HTML that is not to be rendered immediately but may be utilized later via JS.
entity.descriptionClean: A mechanism for holding HTML that is not to be rendered immediately but may be utilized later via JS.

example.codeHighlighted: <template id="counter"> <div class="counter">Clicked {{ times }} times</div> </template>

webFeature.description_html: The <template> HTML element holds HTML fragments which you can clone and insert into the document using JavaScript.
webFeature.name: <template>

entity.descriptionClean: Issues related to learning new technologies

entity.name: Declarative APIs
entity.description: Complaints about lack of declarative APIs (combine with `limitations`), or current declarative APIs (as a whole) being hard to use (combine with `ergonomics`).
entity.descriptionHtml: Complaints about lack of declarative APIs (combine with limitations), or current declarative APIs (as a whole) being hard to use (combine with ergonomics).
entity.descriptionClean: Complaints about lack of declarative APIs (combine with limitations), or current declarative APIs (as a whole) being hard to use (combine with ergonomics).

entity.description: Issues around compatibility with JS frameworks.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues around compatibility with JS frameworks.

entity.name: React compatibility
entity.description: Issues around compatibility with React.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues around compatibility with React.

entity.name: Tooling
entity.description: Issues around third party tools, or lack thereof, including tooling in the browser (extensions, devtools, etc.).
entity.descriptionClean: Issues around third party tools, or lack thereof, including tooling in the browser (extensions, devtools, etc.).

entity.name: HTML Modules
entity.description: Import HTML files via JS imports and access their elements and JS exports.
entity.descriptionClean: Import HTML files via JS imports and access their elements and JS exports.

example.code:
<script type="module">
	import { TabList } from "./tablist.html" with { type: 'html' };
	customElements.define("tab-list", TabList);
</script>
example.codeHighlighted: <script type="module"> import { TabList } from "./tablist.html" with { type: 'html' }; customElements.define("tab-list", TabList); </script>

entity.name: Date & Time
entity.description: Issues related to managing dates and times, including lack of support of modern APIs.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues related to managing dates and times, including lack of support of modern APIs.

entity.name: Shadow DOM
entity.description: Encapsulate elements not visible from the outside, and style them with CSS not affecting the rest of the page.
entity.descriptionClean: Encapsulate elements not visible from the outside, and style them with CSS not affecting the rest of the page.

example.codeHighlighted: this.shadowRoot = this.attachShadow({mode: "open"});

webFeature.description_html: Shadow DOM allows you to attach encapsulated "shadow" DOM trees to elements. A shadow DOM tree is a separate component, isolated from the scripts and styles in other parts of the document. This is a part of Web Components.
webFeature.name: Shadow DOM

entity.name: Content-Security Policy (CSP)
entity.description: A set of directives from a website to a browser, that helps to detect and mitigate XSS attacks.
entity.descriptionClean: A set of directives from a website to a browser, that helps to detect and mitigate XSS attacks.

webFeature.description_html: Content Security Policy (CSP) helps to mitigate certain security threats, including cross-site scripting (XSS) and clickjacking attacks. It consists of a set of directives from a website to a browser, which instruct the browser to restrict the things that the site is allowed to do.
webFeature.name: Content Security Policy (CSP)

entity.name: Sanitizer API
entity.description: `element.setHTML()` and `Document.parseHTML()`. API to prevent XSS attacks by sanitizing untrusted strings of HTML.
entity.descriptionHtml: element.setHTML() and Document.parseHTML(). API to prevent XSS attacks by sanitizing untrusted strings of HTML.
entity.descriptionClean: element.setHTML() and Document.parseHTML(). API to prevent XSS attacks by sanitizing untrusted strings of HTML.

example.codeHighlighted: greeting.setHTML('Hello ' + nameInput.value);

entity.name: Specific platforms & vendors
entity.description: Issues mentioning specific platforms, operating systems, or browser vendors.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues mentioning specific platforms, operating systems, or browser vendors.

entity.name: Apple
entity.description: Issues specific to Apple as a platform or vendor, and the Apple ecosystem (e.g., Safari, WebKit, iOS).
entity.descriptionClean: Issues specific to Apple as a platform or vendor, and the Apple ecosystem (e.g., Safari, WebKit, iOS).

entity.name: DOM APIs
entity.description: Issues related to core DOM manipulation APIs, including issues around creating, updating, or removing DOM nodes via JavaScript APIs.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues related to core DOM manipulation APIs, including issues around creating, updating, or removing DOM nodes via JavaScript APIs.

entity.name: Missing elements
entity.description: The need to build common UI patterns from scratch due to the lack of built-in, accessible HTML elements.
entity.descriptionClean: The need to build common UI patterns from scratch due to the lack of built-in, accessible HTML elements.

entity.name: Tabs element
entity.description: Pain points from the lack of a native HTML element for tabbed interfaces, a common UI pattern.
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points from the lack of a native HTML element for tabbed interfaces, a common UI pattern.

entity.name: Carousel
entity.description: The lack of a native, declarative HTML element for creating carousels or sliders, forcing developers to build them from scratch.
entity.descriptionClean: The lack of a native, declarative HTML element for creating carousels or sliders, forcing developers to build them from scratch.

entity.name: Toast Notifications
entity.description: The lack of a native HTML element or API for creating non-modal, timed "toast" notifications.
entity.descriptionHtml: The lack of a native HTML element or API for creating non-modal, timed "toast" notifications.
entity.descriptionClean: The lack of a native HTML element or API for creating non-modal, timed "toast" notifications.

entity.name: Performance
entity.description: Performance issues
entity.descriptionClean: Performance issues

entity.name: Component-Based Architecture
entity.description: Pain points related to building websites with a component-based model, such as state management, content composition, and framework reliance. Combine with `accessibility`  for accessibility challenges that are specific to or exacerbated by component-based development (e.g., managing heading levels, generating unique IDs).
entity.descriptionHtml: Pain points related to building websites with a component-based model, such as state management, content composition, and framework reliance. Combine with accessibility for accessibility challenges that are specific to or exacerbated by component-based development (e.g., managing heading levels, generating unique IDs).
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points related to building websites with a component-based model, such as state management, content composition, and framework reliance. Combine with accessibility  for accessibility challenges that are specific to or exacerbated by component-based development (e.g., managing heading levels, generating unique IDs).

entity.name: Server-client communication
entity.description: Issues around server-client integration & communication, server-side rendering, etc.
entity.descriptionHtml: Issues around server-client integration & communication, server-side rendering, etc.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues around server-client integration & communication, server-side rendering, etc.

entity.name: SSR & hydration
entity.description: Performance bottlenecks related to the process of making server-rendered HTML interactive on the client using JavaScript frameworks.
entity.descriptionClean: Performance bottlenecks related to the process of making server-rendered HTML interactive on the client using JavaScript frameworks.

entity.name: Streaming
entity.description: Issues related to streaming HTML content from the server to the client, including browser inconsistencies, performance challenges, and hooking up interactivity to streamed content.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues related to streaming HTML content from the server to the client, including browser inconsistencies, performance challenges, and hooking up interactivity to streamed content.

entity.name: CSS Integration
entity.description: Pain points related to the integration between a feature and CSS. For issues arising from the intersection of CSS features and accessibility, such as ensuring modern CSS layouts or 'clever' CSS solutions are accessible, combine with `accessibility`.
entity.descriptionHtml: Pain points related to the integration between a feature and CSS. For issues arising from the intersection of CSS features and accessibility, such as ensuring modern CSS layouts or 'clever' CSS solutions are accessible, combine with accessibility.
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points related to the integration between a feature and CSS. For issues arising from the intersection of CSS features and accessibility, such as ensuring modern CSS layouts or 'clever' CSS solutions are accessible, combine with accessibility.

entity.name: Top Layer
entity.description: Issues related to the top layer, where elements like <dialog> and popovers are rendered. Includes z-index conflicts, stacking order control, and interactions between multiple top-layer elements.
entity.descriptionHtml: Issues related to the top layer, where elements like  and popovers are rendered. Includes z-index conflicts, stacking order control, and interactions between multiple top-layer elements.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues related to the top layer, where elements like  and popovers are rendered. Includes z-index conflicts, stacking order control, and interactions between multiple top-layer elements.

entity.name: Meta-issues
entity.description: Meta-issues not intrinsic to the technology itself or its support in browsers (hardware, spec issues, political issues, etc.).
entity.descriptionClean: Meta-issues not intrinsic to the technology itself or its support in browsers (hardware, spec issues, political issues, etc.).

entity.name: Content State Management
entity.description: The lack of a native, browser-provided mechanism for managing application state, leading to reliance on large frameworks.
entity.descriptionClean: The lack of a native, browser-provided mechanism for managing application state, leading to reliance on large frameworks.

entity.name: Invalid/Spam
entity.description: Nonsense or non‑actionable or off-topic content.
entity.descriptionClean: Nonsense or non‑actionable or off-topic content.

entity.name: Declarative Shadow DOM
entity.description: Define shadow trees with HTML, such as when server-side-rendering web components.
entity.descriptionClean: Define shadow trees with HTML, such as when server-side-rendering web components.

example.codeHighlighted: <host-element> <template shadowrootmode="open"> <!-- Shadow content --> </template> </host-element>

resources.title: GitHub - mfreed7/declarative-shadow-dom: Declarative Shadow DOM feature development

webFeature.description_html: The shadowrootmode attribute on <template> creates a shadow root without the use of JavaScript. It is a declarative alternative to the attachShadow() method.
webFeature.name: Declarative shadow DOM

entity.name: DSD reusability
entity.description: The inability to define a Declarative Shadow DOM template once and reuse it across multiple component instances, leading to HTML bloat and poor ergonomics.
entity.descriptionClean: The inability to define a Declarative Shadow DOM template once and reuse it across multiple component instances, leading to HTML bloat and poor ergonomics.

entity.name: CORS
entity.description: Opt-in to allowing requests from different origins.
entity.descriptionClean: Opt-in to allowing requests from different origins.

entity.name: Low quality results
entity.description: Fidelity issues that are outside the developer’s control or API limitations making it hard to produce high-fidelity results. E.g. rendering is too low quality, low dpi, blurry, browser-generated UI is poor or ugly, etc.
entity.descriptionClean: Fidelity issues that are outside the developer’s control or API limitations making it hard to produce high-fidelity results. E.g. rendering is too low quality, low dpi, blurry, browser-generated UI is poor or ugly, etc.

entity.name: Rendering
entity.description: General issues related to the browser's process of painting pixels on the screen, including layout, style recalculation, and compositing.
entity.descriptionHtml: General issues related to the browser's process of painting pixels on the screen, including layout, style recalculation, and compositing.
entity.descriptionClean: General issues related to the browser's process of painting pixels on the screen, including layout, style recalculation, and compositing.

entity.name: Structured data (RDFa, Microdata, Microformats)
entity.description: Technologies for embedding machine-readable data in HTML.
entity.descriptionClean: Technologies for embedding machine-readable data in HTML.

example.code:
<!-- RDFa: -->
<time property="datePublished" datetime="2009-05-08">May 8, 2009</time>
<!-- Microdata: -->
<time itemprop="datePublished" datetime="2009-05-08">May 8, 2009</time>
<!-- Microformats: -->
<time class="dt-published" datetime="2009-05-08">May 8, 2009</time>
example.codeHighlighted: <!-- RDFa: --> <time property="datePublished" datetime="2009-05-08">May 8, 2009</time> <!-- Microdata: --> <time itemprop="datePublished" datetime="2009-05-08">May 8, 2009</time> <!-- Microformats: --> <time class="dt-published" datetime="2009-05-08">May 8, 2009</time>

resources.title: Structured Data | 2022 | The Web Almanac by HTTP Archive

entity.name: Environments & Consumers
entity.description: Issues relevant to specific environments or consumers of web content, e.g. devices, bots, viewing modes, etc.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues relevant to specific environments or consumers of web content, e.g. devices, bots, viewing modes, etc.

entity.name: Debugging
entity.description: Debugging issues
entity.descriptionClean: Debugging issues

entity.name: Images
entity.description: Still images across the platform, including performance issues around rendering images on a web page.
entity.descriptionClean: Still images across the platform, including performance issues around rendering images on a web page.

entity.name: Reliability
entity.description: Crashes, device/context loss, flaky behavior, and error handling.
entity.descriptionClean: Crashes, device/context loss, flaky behavior, and error handling.

entity.name: Not applicable
entity.description: No use cases, no pain, no issues.
entity.descriptionClean: No use cases, no pain, no issues.

entity.name: Loading
entity.description: General issues related to loading page subresources like scripts, stylesheets, and modules, preloading, or loading UX.
entity.descriptionClean: General issues related to loading page subresources like scripts, stylesheets, and modules, preloading, or loading UX.

entity.name: Community & dev practices
entity.description: Issues related to public perception, community discourse, or web developer practices
entity.descriptionClean: Issues related to public perception, community discourse, or web developer practices

entity.name: Declarative Custom Elements
entity.description: Create web components declaratively through HTML, with or without JS.
entity.descriptionClean: Create web components declaratively through HTML, with or without JS.

example.codeHighlighted: <definition name="progress-ring"> <template shadowmode="open"> <div id="base" role="progressbar" aria-valuemin="0" aria-valuemax="100" aria-valuenow="{{root.attributes.percentage.value}}"> <slot>{{ root.attributes.percentage.value }}%</slot> </div> <style>#base { /* ... */ }</style> </template> </definition> <progress-ring value="50"></progress-ring>

entity.name: End-user experience
entity.description: Issues around difficulties providing a good user experience for end-users. Do not include DX issues here (use `ergonomics` for that).
entity.descriptionHtml: Issues around difficulties providing a good user experience for end-users. Do not include DX issues here (use ergonomics for that).
entity.descriptionClean: Issues around difficulties providing a good user experience for end-users. Do not include DX issues here (use ergonomics for that).

entity.name: Standards & Specs
entity.description: Pain points around specifications and standards (e.g., ISO, WCAG, RGAA).
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points around specifications and standards (e.g., ISO, WCAG, RGAA).

entity.name: Unclear
entity.description: Not enough information to determine what the pain point is.
entity.descriptionClean: Not enough information to determine what the pain point is.

entity.name: Form validation
entity.description: Set of HTML attributes and JS APIs to facilitate client-side form validation (`<input pattern>`, `<input required>`, `input. setCustomValidity(msg)` etc)
entity.descriptionHtml: Set of HTML attributes and JS APIs to facilitate client-side form validation (<input pattern>, <input required>, input. setCustomValidity(msg) etc)
entity.descriptionClean: Set of HTML attributes and JS APIs to facilitate client-side form validation (<input pattern>, <input required>, input. setCustomValidity(msg) etc)

example.codeHighlighted: <input id="zip" pattern="[0-9]{5}" title="5 digits" required />

webFeature.description_html: The light-dark() CSS function accepts two colors and uses one depending on the current color scheme.
webFeature.name: light-dark()

entity.name: Specific platform APIs & capabilities
entity.description: Pain points around APIs opening access to native capabilities, like the Clipboard API, the File System API, etc.
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points around APIs opening access to native capabilities, like the Clipboard API, the File System API, etc.
